intro: Disterigma synanthum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 cm and prefers well-draining soil and bright, indirect light. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and it is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Disterigma synanthum is also known for its ability to thrive in humid environments and its relatively low maintenance requirements.
